com.qozix.layouts

Class ZoomPanLayout

  • java.lang.Object
    • ViewGroup
      • com.qozix.layouts.ZoomPanLayout
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MapView

    public class ZoomPanLayout
extends ViewGroup
    ZoomPanLayout extends ViewGroup to provide support for scrolling and zooming. Fling, drag, pinch and double-tap events are supported natively. ZoomPanLayout does not support direct insertion of child Views, and manages positioning through an intermediary View. the addChild method provides an interface to add layouts to that intermediary view. Each of these children are provided with LayoutParams of MATCH_PARENT for both axes, and will always be positioned at 0,0, so should generally be ViewGroups themselves (RelativeLayouts or FrameLayouts are generally appropriate).

    • Constructor Detail

      • ZoomPanLayout

        public ZoomPanLayout(Context context)
        Constructor to use when creating a ZoomPanLayout from code. Inflating from XML is not currently supported.
        Parameters:
        context - (Context) The Context the ZoomPanLayout is running in, through which it can access the current theme, resources, etc.

    • Method Detail

      • setScaleToFit

        public void setScaleToFit(boolean shouldScaleToFit)
        Determines whether the ZoomPanLayout should limit it's minimum scale to no less than what would be required to fill it's container
        Parameters:
        shouldScaleToFit - (boolean) True to limit minimum scale, false to allow arbitrary minimum scale (see setScaleLimits)

      • setScaleLimits

        public void setScaleLimits(double min,
                  double max)
        Set minimum and maximum scale values for this ZoomPanLayout. Note that if shouldScaleToFit is set to true, the minimum value set here will be ignored Default values are 0 and 1.
        Parameters:
        min -
        max -

      • setShouldIntercept

        public void setShouldIntercept(boolean intercept)
        Sets whether the ZoomPanLayout should intercept touch events on it's child views. If true, the ZoomPanLayout will intercept touch events, so that touch events on child views will not consume the event, so gestures (drag, fling) on the ZoomPanLayout will not be interrupted. If false, child views will consume touch events normally, and will interrupt gesture events on the containing ZoomPanLayout
        Parameters:
        intercept - (boolean) Boolean value indicating whether the ZoomPanLayout should intercept touch events

      • setSize

        public void setSize(int wide,
           int tall)
        Sets the size (width and height) of the ZoomPanLayout as it should be rendered at a scale of 1f (100%)
        Parameters:
        wide - width
        tall - height
